channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
Two days after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, a 27-year old woman, T., delivered her fourth child, Cason.
Born after his mother fled domestic abuse and was denied an abortion, he is among the first of many post-Roe babies expected in Texas. https://t.co/sNUqHyKXEB
Breaking News: New York lawmakers passed a bill prohibiting firearms in many public places, a week after the Supreme Court struck down a state gun control law. https://t.co/Wbo0ELlAdg

Kaleem Ullah Khan has spent a lifetime grafting hundreds of types of mango onto a 120-year-old tree in northern India. His decades of experimentation have earned him fame as the “mango man.” https://t.co/5uOrqk2cMF https://t.co/4lK6txxzLf

The Supreme Court has moved relentlessly to the right, issuing blockbuster decisions on cases from abortion to climate change that will transform U.S. life. By one standard measurement, the term that ended this week was the most conservative since 1931. https://t.co/Cjeixw0dIe https://t.co/0kksaof87y

Manchester United spent $242 million on center-backs and got worse. The Premier League club conceded 57 goals last season, their highest total since 1979. Here’s what needs to change. (via @TheAthleticUK) https://t.co/NSp3m7QYHj
These vegetarian recipes range from minimum effort to medium, but all deliver hugely flavorful results— and are a thrill to grill on Independence Day. https://t.co/UKEio2c4K7 https://t.co/Sle9yu2opg
President Biden said that Americans could expect to continue paying higher gas prices for "as long as it takes" so that Russia cannot "defeat Ukraine and move beyond Ukraine." https://t.co/mPMSDUcZvB

The WNBA star Brittney Griner arrived at a Russian court for the start of a trial on drug charges. Legal experts said it was all but certain to end in a conviction.
Follow updates. https://t.co/sMFmTDBJ5L https://t.co/MVZflzq2gP

New Zealand's government said that the Proud Boys' involvement in the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol was "consistent with the definition of a terrorist act." It is now illegal for New Zealanders to participate in or support the group's activities. https://t.co/tZsKa2u2us

New York City is creating the first mobile testing units in the U.S. that will allow people who test positive for the coronavirus to immediately receive for free the antiviral treatment Paxlovid. https://t.co/a3uzndOwPW

Advice urging women to delete their period tracker apps went viral after Roe v. Wade was overturned.
But experts say other digital information is more likely to put women at risk or reveal an illegal abortion. https://t.co/nhKwltjTaX https://t.co/FBcZozjtVW

Over 15 years of documents reveal that McKinsey & Company gave companies an "in-depth experience in narcotics," a New York Times investigation found. From poppy fields to pills, they show how the consulting firm was at the core of the opioid epidemic. https://t.co/1uESF4mEpR https://t.co/JHymjIA0IX

President Biden said he directed his legal team to work with the Justice Dept. and other federal agencies to “find ways that we can, under federal law, continue protecting Americans from harmful pollution, including pollution that causes climate change.” https://t.co/vXPKlG4Qf2
The Supreme Court’s EPA ruling could make it impossible for President Biden to meet his goal to cut U.S. pollution by half, experts said. https://t.co/KAyWaM63or

The dangers of climate change are mounting so rapidly that they could soon overwhelm the ability of both nature and humanity to adapt unless greenhouse gas emissions are quickly reduced, according to a UN report by 270 researchers from 67 countries. https://t.co/JvRrFLKJwv
Donald Trump’s organization has paid or promised to pay legal fees for Jan. 6 witnesses, raising concerns about efforts to sway their testimony. https://t.co/mJV5Geu9m9

The dangers of climate change are mounting so rapidly that they could soon overwhelm the ability of both nature and humanity to adapt unless greenhouse gas emissions are quickly reduced, according to a UN report by 270 researchers from 67 countries. https://t.co/nn9bE4JxQU

Watch Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson take the judicial oath on Thursday and officially become the first Black woman to serve on the Supreme Court. She replaced Justice Stephen Breyer, who retired. https://t.co/VWwuL8HU22 https://t.co/PyGODYxkbf

Representative Liz Cheney, a Republican of Wyoming, pressed her party to denounce former Donald Trump’s lies and efforts to overturn the 2020 election. “Republicans cannot both be loyal to Donald Trump and loyal to the Constitution,” she said. https://t.co/dC7ZqM5yTu https://t.co/ShA1CmdMar

The Supreme Court's three liberal justices dissented in the ruling limiting the EPA's ability to restrict power plant emissions, writing that the decision strips the agency of "the power to respond to the most pressing environmental challenge of our time." https://t.co/lUcpgRUGD8 https://t.co/6h8PcN4vxN
White House aides say President Biden is irked by his party’s persistent questions over his plans to seek re-election in 2024. https://t.co/Hh8zNnC9XK
Breaking News: A judge said he would temporarily block a Florida law banning abortions after 15 weeks of pregnancy because it violated the state’s Constitution. https://t.co/SgywFNKkg6
Breaking News: The Supreme Court sided with President Biden on his effort to end the Trump-era "Remain in Mexico" program for asylum seekers. https://t.co/4vE2kFpOU4
Britain will give Ukraine an additional $1.2 billion in military support for its war against Russia, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said, nearly doubling the British commitment. https://t.co/9u6lGEezgL
A trove of documents revealed how McKinsey & Company helped opioid makers target doctors, drive up sales and market pills twice as potent as OxyContin. https://t.co/KVsiapegCj https://t.co/56xPTTrUTE
Watch live: Ketanji Brown Jackson is set to take the judicial oath, becoming the first Black woman to serve on the Supreme Court. https://t.co/cefezwrRtl
Ketanji Brown Jackson is officially the first Black woman to serve on the Supreme Court, after taking the judicial oath on Thursday. https://t.co/J5dhi5O5r9

The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol issued a subpoena Wednesday for the testimony of Pat Cipollone, the White House counsel to Donald Trump. https://t.co/75Qh3btaKa

An unserved arrest warrant for the white woman whose accusations led to Emmett Till's gruesome death in 1955 has been found in a courthouse basement. People working on Till's behalf said they hope the discovery provides a basis for a new investigation. https://t.co/9CVmpacxvc

In a speech, Representative Liz Cheney described Donald Trump as a threat to the republic who had “gone to war with the rule of law,” adding that Republican leaders had “made themselves willing hostages to this dangerous and irrational man.” https://t.co/4DUUuFel4q
Breaking News: The Supreme Court limited the EPA’s ability to regulate power plant emissions, a major ruling with potential impact well beyond the climate. https://t.co/GZDXHpOWew

A team of experts searching through a shipwreck off the coast of Greece dredged up what researchers believe is the marble head of a Hercules statue from ancient Rome dating back about 2,000 years. https://t.co/fh4YUUmBoq https://t.co/DfxmuLZPmb

Breaking News: President Biden condemned what he called the “outrageous behavior” of the Supreme Court in overturning Roe v. Wade and said he would back ending the filibuster to codify abortion rights. https://t.co/tWaEfssVXh

Randy Cox was arrested by police officers in New Haven, Connecticut, and was being driven in a van when it suddenly stopped. He is now in the hospital, barely able to move. After he was injured, officers mocked him for being unable to sit up, a video shows.https://t.co/h5kh4O7TvP
Breaking News: Ukraine drove Russian troops from Snake Island in the Black Sea, a setback for Moscow that could undermine its control over shipping lanes. https://t.co/RJ7xFE5l8m

Ghislaine Maxwell, who conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually exploit underage girls, was sentenced to 20 years in prison on Tuesday by a judge who cited her pivotal role in a horrific scheme that spanned continents and years. https://t.co/ob15jmeQ2A

CRISPR, the gene-editing system that was discovered 10 years ago, has become one of the most celebrated inventions in modern biology. It has changed how medical researchers study diseases and it edits genes that cause hereditary diseases. https://t.co/0vLDjMKVuH

In a speech, Representative Liz Cheney described Donald Trump as a threat to the republic who had “gone to war with the rule of law,” adding that GOP leaders had “made themselves willing hostages to this dangerous and irrational man.” https://t.co/LxvTL6DE0t
Breaking News: A 20-year-old woman was fatally shot while she pushed a 3-month-old child in a stroller on Manhattan’s Upper East Side, the police said. https://t.co/LuBeEGQjZW

New York officials on Wednesday filed suit against 10 companies that sell components for untraceable firearms known as ghost guns, under a new state law intended to hold the gun industry accountable for shootings. https://t.co/vNY0NI77Gp
The R&B singer R. Kelly was sentenced to 30 years in prison for racketeering and sex trafficking. https://t.co/4SWwrW4WRE https://t.co/LXIuL8Sjkp

News Analysis: In the final, frenzied days of his administration, Donald Trump’s behavior turned increasingly volatile as he smashed dishware and lunged at his own Secret Service agent, according to Cassidy Hutchinson's testimony. https://t.co/1wNjSfhN0M

Rapes were among the many atrocities Russian troops inflicted on Ukrainian civilians during weeks of occupation.
Women who were attacked in a village near Kyiv want justice, but Ukrainian officials face daunting challenges in prosecuting such crimes. https://t.co/Gb4whPRsHP

Illinois may stand alone as an island of abortion access for a swath of the Midwest and the South as neighboring states have banned, or move to ban, the procedure. The 29 abortion providers in Illinois worry that they may not be able to meet the demand. https://t.co/eW8uiZu9nc https://t.co/33kj5PQN7k

R. Kelly's sentencing on Wednesday came after decades of accusations of sexual and physical abuse. He is scheduled to stand trial again in Chicago on Aug. 15, where he faces federal charges for producing child pornography and luring minors into sex acts. https://t.co/YwYUqNOdsB
For one afternoon, the Jan. 6 investigation played like the Watergate hearings as punched up by the writer’s room of “24,” our chief television critic writes. https://t.co/oQP48xjjM2

R. Kelly, the former R&B singer long accused of sexually abusing minors, is likely to spend much of the rest of his life in prison after being sentenced on Wednesday to 30 years for sex trafficking and racketeering. https://t.co/jxOtb18IOU https://t.co/sxFlK4daNI
Breaking News: R. Kelly, the former R&B singer long accused of sexually abusing minors, was sentenced to 30 years in prison for sex trafficking and racketeering. https://t.co/mKj7K7A1Y2
Hershel Williams, the last survivor among the 472 servicemen who were awarded the Medal of Honor for extraordinary bravery in World War II, has died. He was 98. https://t.co/F13aNDsaHR

Speaker Nancy Pelosi met with Pope Francis on Wednesday and received communion from a Vatican priest. Conservative U.S. bishops like Pelosi's hometown priest have said they will deny her the sacrament until she stops publicly supporting abortion rights. https://t.co/G2izikP0LW https://t.co/KQXWcm91cz
